Toward First Results

January 24, 2017

Introduction

The formula

V_{ex}\propto\int\left[\int\sin \theta_{ij}\frac{d\epsilon_{i}}{\epsilon_{\text{sum}}}\right]\frac{d\epsilon_{j}}{\epsilon_{\text{sum}}},

was introduced by saevik. The variable V_{ex} is the Excluded Volume balberg,saevik. Other interesting formulas include

E = mc^2, \mathbf{u}=-K\left(\nabla p+\rho g\nabla z\right),

where einstein is Einstein’s famous formula, and darcy is Darcy’s law.

1 2 2 4  
      kg/m^3  
         
         
E = mc^2,

References

  1. Sævik, P. N., Berre, I., Jakobsen, M., & Lien, M. (2013). A 3D Computational Study of Effective Medium Methods Applied to Fractured Media. Transport in Porous Media, 100(1), 115–142. doi:10.1007/s11242-013-0208-0
  2. Berkowitz, B., & Balberg, I. (1992). Percolation approach to the problem of hydraulic conductivity in porous media. Transport in Porous Media, 9(3), 275–286. doi:10.1007/BF00611971
